edu.biu.scapi.circuits.garbledCircuit
Interface GarbledBooleanCircuit

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractGarbledBooleanCircuit, FreeXORGarbledBooleanCircuit, MinimizeAESSetKeyGarbledBooleanCircuit, StandardGarbledBooleanCircuit
public interface GarbledBooleanCircuit

GarbledBooleanCircuit is a general interface implemented by all garbled circuits--optimized or not. All garbled circuits have four main functions. The construct function which is provided by the constructor of the implementing classes. The compute() function computes a result on a garbled circuit that's input has been set. The translate(Map) method translates the garbled output from compute() into meaningful output. The verify(BooleanCircuit, Map) method is used in the case of a malicious adversary to verify that the garbled circuit created is an honest garbling of the agreed upon non garbled) circuit. The constructing party constructs many garbled circuits and the second party chooses all but one of them to verify and test the honesty of the constructing party.

Author:
Steven Goldfeder

Method Detail

compute

java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,GarbledWire> compute()
                                                     throws java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                                                            javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException,
                                                            CiphertextTooLongException,
                                                            KeyNotSetException,
                                                            TweakNotSetException,
                                                            InputNotSetException
This method computes the circuit if input has been set. If input has not been set it throws an exception. It returns a Map containing the garbled output. This output can be translated via the translate(Map) method.

Returns:
returns a Map that maps the label of the output wire to the garbled value of the wire
Throws:
java.security.InvalidKeyException
javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException
CiphertextTooLongException
KeyNotSetException

translate

java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,Wire> translate(java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,GarbledWire> garbledOutput)
Translates the garbled output obtained from the compute() function into meaningful(i.e. 0-1) output.

Parameters:
garbledOutput - a Map) that containing the garbled output. This map maps the output wire labels to {@code GarbledWire}s
Returns:
a Map that maps the output wire labels to ungarbled Wires that are set to either 0 or 1.

verify

boolean verify(BooleanCircuit ungarbledCircuit,
               java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,javax.crypto.SecretKey[]> allInputWireValues)
               throws java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                      javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException,
                      KeyNotSetException,
                      TweakNotSetException,
                      PlaintextTooLongException,
                      CiphertextTooLongException
The verify method is used in the case of malicious adversaries. Alice constructs n circuits and Bob can verify n-1 of them(of his choosing) to confirm that they are indeed garblings of the agreed upon non garbled circuit. In order to verify, Alice has to give Bob both garbled values for each of the input wires.

Parameters:
ungarbledCircuit - the circuit that this GarbledBooleanCircuit is supposed to be a garbling of. This is the circuit that Alice and Bob agreed upon in Yao's protocol. We are verifying that this GarbledBooleanCircuit is indeed a garbling of the agreed upon ungarbled circuit
allInputWireValues - a containing both garbled values for each input wire. For each input wire label, the map contains an array of two values. The value in the 0 position is the 0 encoding, and the value in the 1 position is the 1 encoding.
Returns:
true if this GarbledBooleanCircuit is a garbling of the ungarbledCircuit, false if it is not
Throws:
java.security.InvalidKeyException
javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException
KeyNotSetException
TweakNotSetException
PlaintextTooLongException
CiphertextTooLongException

setInputs

void setInputs(java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,GarbledWire> presetInputWires)
This method sets the input. It takes as a parameter a Map that maps the input Wire labels to a garbled wire containing the appropriate garbled value. See setGarbledInputFromUngarbledFile(File, Map) for an alternate way of setting the input.

Parameters:
presetInputWires - a Map containing the input wires that have been preset with their values

setGarbledInputFromUngarbledFile

void setGarbledInputFromUngarbledFile(java.io.File f,
                                      java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,javax.crypto.SecretKey[]> allInputWireValues)
                                      throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
This method takes in a file containing the number of inputs followed by the GarbledWire label and non garbled value for each wire. This method than performs the lookup on the accompanying allInputWireValues Map and sets the inputs to the corresponding garbled outputs.

Parameters:
f - the file containing the number of input wire followed by a list of input wire labels and their garbled values
allInputWireValues - the map containing both garbled values for each input wire
Throws:
java.io.FileNotFoundException
